title: UK green hydrogen pioneer GeoPura backed with £36m investment - Barclays
summary: GeoPura, a UK company, secured £36m investment to scale up its green hydrogen business, which provides zero-emission power generation through Hydrogen Power Units (HPUs) to replace diesel generators. The investment will enable GeoPura to mass manufacture HPUs, increasing production of green hydrogen to fuel the units and driving green skills in the UK. The company's HPUs are used in industries such as construction, infrastructure, outdoor events, EV charging, and back-up power, displacing diesel-fuelled generators and enabling zero-emissions energy across the board.

title: Vestas unveils circularity solution to end landfill for turbine blades - Vestas
summary: Vestas has developed a new solution that renders epoxy-based turbine blades circular, without the need for changing the design or composition of blade material. The solution combines newly discovered chemical technology developed within the CETEC initiative, and partnerships with Olin and Stena Recycling. Once mature, this will eliminate the need for blade redesign, or landfill disposal of epoxy-based blades when they are decommissioned.
green_innovation: TRUE. The innovation is a new chemical process that can chemically break down epoxy resin into virgin-grade materials. This enables the circularity of epoxy-based turbine blades, reducing environmental impact.
business_innovation: TRUE. The innovation is a new chemical process that can chemically break down epoxy resin into virgin-grade materials. This process has the potential to be scaled up and commercialized, representing a significant business innovation.
green_product: TRUE. The innovation is a new chemical process that can chemically break down epoxy resin into virgin-grade materials. This process enables the circularity of epoxy-based turbine blades, reducing environmental impact and promoting the use of recycled materials in the production of new blades.
green_process: TRUE. The innovation is a new chemical process that can chemically break down epoxy resin into virgin-grade materials. This process reduces waste, conserves natural resources, decreases energy consumption, and limits the release of harmful substances into the environment.
product_or_process: chemical process that can chemically break down epoxy resin into virgin-grade materials

title: LiTime: New Possibilities in the Lithium Battery Industry - Yahoo Finance
summary: LiTime, formerly known as Ampere Time, is a leading provider of LiFePO4 lithium batteries and renewable energy solutions. The company's batteries are designed to be lightweight, powerful, and maintenance-free, and they offer a long lifespan of 4000+ deep cycles at 100% Depth of Discharge (DoD). LiTime is committed to sustainability, and the company's products are designed to help people reduce their environmental impact.

title: Breakthrough technology transforms waste plastic bottles into polymers for lithium-ion batteries - EurekAlert
summary: Researchers at A*STAR's Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE) have successfully developed a method to upcycle waste polyethylene terephthalate (PET) plastic into polymer electrolytes, a key component for safer lithium-ion batteries (LiBs).  The study represents the first working lithium-ion battery assembled using polymers upcycled from PET plastics. The team used waste PET bottles to design polyurethane-based polymer electrolytes, which showed promising performance as gel polymer electrolytes for LiBs, achieving a room temperature conductivity of 10-4 S/cm and successfully assembling a working LiB using these polymers.
green_innovation: TRUE. The innovation is a new and improved method to upcycle waste PET plastic into polymer electrolytes for safer lithium-ion batteries, which contributes to environmental sustainability goals by reducing plastic waste and promoting the use of sustainable materials in energy storage.
business_innovation: TRUE. The innovation is a new and improved method to upcycle waste PET plastic into polymer electrolytes for safer lithium-ion batteries, which is a new or improved business process for one or more business functions that differs significantly from the firm’s previous business processes and that has been brought into use in the firm.
green_product: TRUE. The innovation is a new and improved product (polymer electrolytes for safer lithium-ion batteries) that is made from upcycled waste PET plastic, which reduces negative environmental externalities by reducing plastic waste and promoting the use of sustainable materials.
green_process: TRUE. The innovation is a new and improved process to upcycle waste PET plastic into polymer electrolytes for safer lithium-ion batteries, which minimizes environmental impacts by reducing plastic waste and promoting the use of sustainable materials.
